metadata.title: Analyzing Stocks Portfolio. Data Viz, and Storytelling During… | by Vincent Tatan | Towards Data Science
metadata.description: On May 22nd 2019, I deployed my investing dashboard, created my own portfolio and wrote about progress. I have been using this dashboard to collect important ratios and numbers to calculate the stock…

outgoing_paragraph_urls.anchor_text: oil stocks market to drop to 17 years low
Asmoth Damodaran, NYU professor teaching valuation, talks about such importance in his book

all_paragraphs: On May 22nd 2019, I deployed my investing dashboard, created my own portfolio and wrote about progress.

I have been using this dashboard to collect important ratios and numbers to calculate the stock value. Since then, I have received requests to update the progress of the stock portfolio I have especially during this pandemic time.

Thankfully, as my current master semester is ending and I slowly built up good Work From Home (WFH) habits. I had time to re-evaluate my personal stock portfolio and update it especially during the tough moments of coronavirus pandemics. This pandemic will be a stress test to see how my portfolio performs.

Disclaimer: This analysis is conducted at 10th of April, which is not the trough of the stock market during corona virus pandemic declaration in early March. I am not a finance professional and have never worked in investment setups. Instead, I am a data practitioner trying to analyse and communicate ideas to solve problems and bring impacts. All of the portfolios and stock purchases I made is purely for my own personal benefit and evaluation for my own value investing tool and methodology.

This portfolio analysis includes my latest purchase of oil during the trough (when coronavirus is marked as a pandemic — 13/3/2020). However, surprisingly, if you focus on my old purchase during 2017 and 2018. I still received huge 75.87% stocks gain from Keppel DC Reits for and 41.61% for Qualcomm. I bought these stocks after Bitcoin Crash and Apple Lawsuits respectively.

I am surprised that my portfolio still performs well despite the entire Corona Virus pandemics in the stocks market. The number shows that it was the right move for me to purchase strong stocks within the right margin of safety (15%) with a conservative discounted rate and risk calculation.
When you buy strong stocks at cheap price, you have less to worry about the market

On 11th March 2020, WHO declared the Corona Virus as Pandemic, which leads the oil stocks market to drop to 17 years low due to the existing pandemic and price competition set up by Saudi Arabia and Russia. This shows that there is so much fear about the pandemic to reduce the oil stock prices sharply. Feel free to find the dashboard I deployed here.

Simply put, I think these are well established companies which will stay even 10 years in the future. Oil consumption will always be needed and there are no threats of comparable renewable sources of energy that are coming soon.
In general, these are some warning signs and critical financial ratio for you to look at:

Given list of the companies, find out the feasibility to investBeen in market minimal 10 yearsHave the track records (EPS per year)Have efficiency (ROE > 15%) — Net income / shareholder equityDetermine manipulation (ROA > 7%) — Net income / Total AssetHave small long term debt (Long term debt <5* total income)Low Debt to EquityAbility to pay interest: (Interest Coverage Ratio >3) — EBIT / Interest expenses
There are many reasons for the fear during the trough of oil prices, but I believe the fear is not going to last in the long run:

Due to the low price for the strong stock, I decided to put some reserves of my cash into oil, so far I have received 11.69% stock gain in CVX and 16.47% stock gain in XOM, only time knows what the exact total payoff is after the economy fully recovers.

I believe strong investments are necessary for every household to make informed decisions about their finances. In this tough pandemic where people are laid off, the stakes are very high to have a personal portfolio. Hopefully, this article could be a starting point for you to think about investing from a quantitative and qualitative point of view.

I personally enjoyed looking at the numbers and formulating stories that come from the numbers. Furthermore, investing is a good practice for me as a data practitioner to practice my skills and arms of trades in analytics and storytelling. Asmoth Damodaran, NYU professor teaching valuation, talks about such importance in his book. Furthermore, feel free to take a look at my basic tutorial here.
I hope to release these updates every month after I do my stocks portfolio housekeeping. Hopefully, these updates can inspire you to get started in analysing your investment portfolio especially.
Rule No 1: Never lose money.
Rule No 2: Never forget rule No 1
I really hope this has been a great read and a source of inspiration for you to develop and innovate.

This idea starts from a few university friends of mine who are enthusiastic to manage their financial portfolios. They gave me a lot of feedback to understand technical jargon and common problems for households to invest. As a new Grad looking to invest my income, they were the right persons for me to learn from.

Please Comment out below for suggestions and feedback. Just like you, I am still learning how to become a better Data Scientist and Engineer. Please help me improve so that I could help you better in my subsequent article releases.
Thank you and Happy coding :)

Vincent Tatan is a Data and Technology enthusiast with relevant working experiences from Google LLC, Visa Inc. and Lazada to implement microservice architectures, business intelligence, and analytics pipeline projects.
Vincent is a native Indonesian with a record of accomplishments in problem-solving with strengths in Full Stack Development, Data Analytics, and Strategic Planning.

He has been actively consulting SMU BI & Analytics Club, guiding aspiring data scientists and engineers from various backgrounds, and opening up his expertise for businesses to develop their products.
Lastly, please reach out to Vincent via LinkedIn, Medium or Youtube Channel
Your home for data science. A Medium publication sharing concepts, ideas and codes.
I fight phishing with ML @ Google. I use advanced ML algorithms and MLOps to protect Chrome, Gmail and Android users. Please reach out to me on Linkedin.
